Guides

Published

February 1, 2024

Keywords

guides, how-to, ai risk, model risk management, ValidMind

Whether you’re new to ValidMind or an experienced user, our guides provide how-to instructions for tasks that you perform in the Platform UI.

To make it easier to find the right guide, we’ve grouped the most common tasks for you:

  • Onboarding
  • Model documentation
  • Model validation

This section primarily covers tasks you perform in the Platform UI. To get started with documenting models in your own development environment, refer to the Developer Framework section.

Onboarding

Setting up your organization

Tasks for platform administrators typically involve configuring ValidMind for use by other members of your organization, both for the initial setup and for ongoing platform administration:

Manage users and roles
User management involves controlling and organizing user accounts within the ValidMind Platform UI. It encompasses tasks like user creation, authentication, authorization, and access control. Effective user management is essential for maintaining security and operational efficiency.
FUTURE: Configure workflows
As part of the initial setup of the ValidMind solution for your company or organization, you need to configure the validation workflows that users such as model developers and model validators will follow.
FUTURE: Import documentation templates

Configure documentation project templates
Learn how to edit templates that get used for model documentation or for validation reports. This topic is relevant for administrators who need to configure templates for specific use cases or where the existing templates supplied by ValidMind need to be customized.
FUTURE: Create inventory model
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed faucibus, urna vel dignissim fringilla, est justo rhoncus ex, nec gravida eros nisl a nisi. Suspendisse potenti. Vivamus feugiat, purus at tempor auctor, elit justo hendrerit massa, eget aliquam sapien nisi eget justo.
Configure AWS PrivateLink
Learn how to configure AWS PrivateLink to establish a private connection between ValidMind and your company network without exposing traffic to the public internet. PrivateLink improves the security and compliance of your applications and data by keeping traffic private and reducing the attack surface of your network.
No matching items

Configuring the model inventory

Model documentation

Guides to get you started:

Register models in the inventory
Learn how to register a model you are documenting in the model inventory. This topic is relevant for model owners who want to enable their model development teams to use ValidMind’s model documentation and validation features.
Create documentation projects
Learn how to create a new documentation project in the ValidMind Platform. You use documentation projects to upload tests and documentation to the ValidMind Platform, review and validate models, and generate validation reports.
Get started with the ValidMind Developer Framework
Learn how to use the ValidMind Developer Framework to document and test your models in your own development environment. This section introduces you to its functionalities and is relevant for model developers.
No matching items

Working on model documentation:

Code samples
Our code samples, based on Jupyter notebooks, are designed to showcase the capabilities and features of the Developer Framework and ValidMind Platform, while also providing you with useful examples that you can build on and adapt for your own use cases.
Document models with the ValidMind UI
Learn how to use the ValidMind UI editor to edit the content of a documentation project. This topic is relevant for model developers who want to make qualitative edits to model documentation they have uploaded through the ValidMind Developer Framework.
Collaborate on documentation projects
Learn how ValidMind enhances collaboration between model validators and developers on documentation projects. This topic is relevant for model validators who want to track changes across projects, add comments, and access revision history for real-time collaboration with model developers.
Submit for approval
Learn how to use the ValidMind UI to view the approval workflow configured by an administrator and to submit projects for review and approval according to that workflow. This topic is relevant for:
No matching items

Model validation

Build validation reports
Use the ValidMind UI editor to create, edit, and publish validation reports for a given model. This topic is relevant for model validators who want to capture their observations and conclusions on the model documentation prepared by a model developer.
Customize validation reports
